description: Borrowed from Latin āreola (“small vacant space, garden”), diminutive of ārea. Doublet of areole.

nouns.description: areola (plural areolas or areolae or areolæ)

entries.meaning: (anatomy) The colored circle around a nipple, more exactly known as areola mammae.

(by extension, anatomy) Any small circular area that is different from its immediate environment, such as the colored ring around the pupil of the eye (iris) or an inflamed region surrounding a pimple.
(anatomy) Any of the small spaces throughout areolar connective tissue.
examples: The tubes or elongated spaces of which we have spoken, are not distended with any fluid, but are merely moistened in the same way as the areolas of ordinary areolar tissue.
